intro: Secamone mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or white. The plant has a slender, branching stem and produces small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
